Ok got my Fathers Glory ....the subs didn't come through tho-..I must of done some thing wrong...

I had gone to vidio with vlc player and clicked on sub title track..and.. just got a whole lot of folders pop up but none of them when I opened them had the subs in them...
I don't get so much about how this works I will have to find some one to show me I guess..
Thank you for movie any way I will get it worked out sooner or later

Well, VLC loads subtitles automatically, if they have the same file-name as the movie file - but only have different extension. For instance, here we have:
/La.gloire.de.mon.pere.1990.H264[PC.Mac.Xbox.PS3.ipod].en.srt 99.12 KiB 
/La.gloire.de.mon.pere.1990.H264[PC.Mac.Xbox.PS3.ipod].mp4 375.54 MiB 
/La.gloire.de.mon.pere.1990.H264[PC.Mac.Xbox.PS3.ipod].nl.srt 101.15 KiB 
/La.gloire.de.mon.pere.1990.H264[PC.Mac.Xbox.PS3.ipod].pt.srt 100.04 KiB 

everything is fine, undoubtedly OK, and when one starts to play movie-file (mp4) ALL subtitles are loaded in the same moment. Languages (two letter code in file name - does not appear in VLC player, but does in Media Player Classic (but MPC has totally different setup). So, one MUST have/do two things in VLC:
1. In "Video" menu, in "Subtitles tracks" UN-MARK "Disable"
2. Choose the right language by choosing Track 1, Track 2 et.c.
Thats all.
Maybe your VLC is screwed-up. Delete the Settings folder in "Documents and settings"  Application data VLC and play the file again.
If it works here, now and as I have explained - it would work anywhere and for anyone.
Thank you kind sir I got it working ta daaaa
